labels.analysis: The MCP Server described specializes in integrating with the Teamwork project management API, allowing users to manage projects, tasks, people, and other resources through a simplified interface. The tools provided cover a wide range of project and task management operations, including retrieval, creation, updating, and deletion of resources. The core functionality revolves around seamlessly interacting with Teamwork's API to enhance workflow productivity and organization.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Project Management" was chosen because the server's primary functionality revolves around managing projects and tasks, which is central to project management workflows. The secondary label "API Integration" was selected as the server's core purpose is to interact with Teamwork's API. The custom label "Task Tracking" was added to highlight the specific focus on managing detailed task operations, which is a key aspect of the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Teamwork API Integration Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Vizioz/Teamwork-MCP
server_info_crawled.overview: Connect to the Teamwork API to manage projects, tasks, people, companies, comments, reporting, and time entries through a simplified MCP interface. Retrieve, create, update, and delete Teamwork resources seamlessly. Enhance your workflow by integrating Teamwork data and actions into your applications and agents.

tools.name: getProjects
tools.description: Deploy Server Teamwork API Integration Server Claim Server @Vizioz/Teamwork-MCP Try in Playground getProjects

tools.name: getCurrentProject
tools.description: Get the current solution's Teamwork project, always check the `.teamwork` file in the root of the solution for the Teamwork project ID or ask the user which project they are working on.

tools.name: createProject
tools.description: Create a new project in Teamwork

tools.name: getTasks
tools.description: Get tasks, Return multiple tasks according to the optional provided filter. Add Item Add Item

tools.name: getTasksByProjectId
tools.description: Get all tasks from a specific project in Teamwork

tools.name: getTaskListsByProjectId
tools.description: Get all task lists by project ID

tools.name: getTaskById
tools.description: Get a specific task by ID from Teamwork

tools.name: createTask
tools.description: Creates a task. Create a new task in the provided task list.

tools.name: createSubTask
tools.description: Creates a subtask. Create a new subtask under the provided parent task.

tools.name: updateTask
tools.description: Update an existing task. Modify the properties of an existing task.

tools.name: getTasksMetricsComplete
tools.description: Get the total count of completed tasks in Teamwork

tools.name: getTasksMetricsLate
tools.description: Get the total count of late tasks in Teamwork

tools.name: getTaskSubtasks
tools.description: Get all subtasks for a specific task in Teamwork

tools.name: getTaskComments
tools.description: Get comments for a specific task from Teamwork

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Vizioz/Teamwork-MCP/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
